verses.roman:
kṛntanaṁ cāvayavaśo
gajādibhyo bhidāpanam
pātanaṁ giri-śṛṅgebhyo
rodhanaṁ cāmbu-gartayoḥ

synonyms: kṛntanam—cutting off; ca—and; avayavaśaḥ—limb by limb; gaja-ādibhyaḥ—by elephants and so on; bhidāpanam—tearing; pātanam—hurling down; giri—of hills; śṛṅgebhyaḥ—from the tops; rodhanam—enclosing; ca—and; ambu-gartayoḥ—in water or in a cave.
translation: Next his limbs are lopped off and torn asunder by elephants. He is hurled down from hilltops, and he is also held captive either in water or in a cave.
